ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Perfect place for this question
ygData.msgSnippet: I had the same experience.  I dated somebody 10 years older than myself and after a short while into our relationship, it caused problems.  I thought he was
ygData.messageBody:
I had the same experience. I dated somebody 10 years
older than myself and after a short while into our
relationship, it caused problems. I thought he was
the perfect person, and he was, however... I was
young, just a few years out of High School and had
differant dreams and ambitions. He had already
experienced those things 10 years earlier. It became
a big problem because he wanted to move forward, have
kids, get a house, and everything. Where as I wanted
to play, party, and generally be a 20 year old. I
have seen some relationships work with that big of an
age gap, however, it is very very tough.


--- "Suzanne J. Johnson" <katannah@...> wrote:
> Soooooooo... what was the question? The generation
> gap causing difficulties
> later on? That's really the only thing you have to
> think about. I dated
> someone 14 years older than me and since our life
> experiences were so
> different, and our aims and goals so different, we
> were unable to resolve
> our disparity. Of course, we couldn't tell that at
> the beginning of the
> relationship. It took three years out of our lives
> and caused a great deal
> of anguish, as neither of us could forgive the other
> for not bridging that
> gap more perfectly. Like I said (IMO), that's the
> big question. The only
> question, actually.
>
> Suzanne
> "Courage is the price that life exacts for granting
> peace."
> ~Amelia Earhart
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Just me" <scadis@...>
> To: <EQ_women@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Sunday, April 27, 2003 2:46 AM
> Subject: [EQ_women] Perfect place for this question
>
>
> > Ok, to keep with this same line of thought ~ of
> "hooking up" on EQ.
> > I am 43 and have been playing EQ for about a year.
> A friend got me
> > into the game, and I played it just as a game. I
> don't think I
> > realized how much I looked forward to running into
> certain
> > friends/characters in the game. I have made what I
> feel to be many
> > good friendships. Ok to the question. One friend
> that I felt very
> > close to became closer. We talked on the phone and
> kept in touch
> > almost everyday. I am divorced and single and he
> is single. He came
> > to Arizona to visit me and sure one thing led to
> another and the
> > rest is history. We are both wildly happy and in
> love, want to spend
> > the rest of our lives together and fade into the
> sunset happily ever
> > after. Here is my dilema ~ like I said I am 43, a
> young 43 (and its
> > not me saying that) my picture is on my profile ~
> he is 20, a very
> > mature, responsible 20 but none the less 20. What
> in the hell do I
> > do??? Most of me wants to say screw what others
> might think and just
> > be happy with him, but the rest of me says leave
> him to live his
> > life. When I discuss that with him he just says
> stop trying to find
> > excuses why we can't be together and just be
> happy. How can I argue
> > with that??? Some advice ladies?? please
> >
>
>
